title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 02 - Basic concepts of SAR
text:
In this week, we will review basic concepts of synthetic aperture radar (SAR).
In addition, we will follow a tutorial to learn how to classify land cover using SAR data.

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 1
Satellites measure the reflectance of features on the ground

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 2
Land cover classification is a simple process of grouping pixels based on spectral properties

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 3
Spectral resolution is the number of bands available from a particular sensor

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 4
Measuring the differences between two land cover maps created from imagery acquired at different times will provide the most reliable estimate of land cover change.

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 5
Landsat TM imagery is suitable to consistently classify natural vegetation genus and species information with a high level of accuracy

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Statement 6
Square pixels in an image accurately represent a square area on the Earthâ€™s surface

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Reading, doing and writing
A flipped classroom is structured around the idea that lecture or direct instruction is not the best use of class time. Instead students encounter information before class, freeing class time for activities that involve higher order thinking

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Read this document
This chapter focuses on Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data. It provides an introduction to SAR systems and detail how data are acquired, whereas the main parameters are introduced. Radar systems are based on the interaction of the radar emitted and transmitted signals with targets.
Frery, Wu and Gomez, 2022. SAR Image Analysisâ€” A Computational Statistics Approach with R Code, Data, and Applications

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 01 Introduction
text:
Watch this video
In this talk, the basics of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) are introduced. It starts with an overview of the heritage of SAR and give a clear and comprehensive picture of SAR imaging techniques. Youâ€™ll learn how SAR sensors work and what they measure. It explains standard SAR imaging modes and the unique advantages SAR can deliver.
Speaker: Tom Ager (ICEYE)

title: 2027449 - PERCEPCION REMOTA AVANZADA
text:
ğŸ“‘ Course Brief
Focus: the focus of this course is to gain knowledge for developing novel remote sensing analysis workflows.
How: reading, learning by doing and writing


ğŸ¯ Learning Objectives

Appraise the process of image analysis and its relation to research.
Understand the physical principles of optical and radar-based remote sensing.
Distinguish the main steps for SAR images correction.
Apply advanced computational techniques to obtain thematic information from Earth Observation data.


Select Academic Year/Term:
 2023

title: ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 03 - SAR response of soil and crops
text:

In addition, we will follow a tutorial to learn how to classify crop using SAR multitemporal data.
